42/**
43 * SECTION:hb-font
44 * @title: hb-font
45 * @short_description: Font objects
46 * @include: hb.h
47 *
48 * Functions for working with font objects.
49 *
50 * A font object represents a font face at a specific size and with
51 * certain other parameters (pixels-per-em, points-per-em, variation
52 * settings) specified. Font objects are created from font face
53 * objects, and are used as input to hb_shape(), among other things.
54 *
55 * Client programs can optionally pass in their own functions that
56 * implement the basic, lower-level queries of font objects. This set
57 * of font functions is defined by the virtual methods in
58 * #hb_font_funcs_t.
59 *
60 * HarfBuzz provides a built-in set of lightweight default
61 * functions for each method in #hb_font_funcs_t.
62 **/
63
64
65/*
66 * hb_font_funcs_t
67 */
68
69static hb_bool_t
70hb_font_get_font_h_extents_nil (hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
71 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
72 hb_font_extents_t *extents,
73 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
74{
75 hb_memset (s: extents, c: 0, n: sizeof (*extents));
76 return false;
77}
78
79static hb_bool_t
80hb_font_get_font_h_extents_default (hb_font_t *font,
81 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
82 hb_font_extents_t *extents,
83 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
84{
85 hb_bool_t ret = font->parent->get_font_h_extents (extents);
86 if (ret) {
87 extents->ascender = font->parent_scale_y_distance (v: extents->ascender);
88 extents->descender = font->parent_scale_y_distance (v: extents->descender);
89 extents->line_gap = font->parent_scale_y_distance (v: extents->line_gap);
90 }
91 return ret;
92}
93
94static hb_bool_t
95hb_font_get_font_v_extents_nil (hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
96 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
97 hb_font_extents_t *extents,
98 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
99{
100 hb_memset (s: extents, c: 0, n: sizeof (*extents));
101 return false;
102}
103
104static hb_bool_t
105hb_font_get_font_v_extents_default (hb_font_t *font,
106 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
107 hb_font_extents_t *extents,
108 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
109{
110 hb_bool_t ret = font->parent->get_font_v_extents (extents);
111 if (ret) {
112 extents->ascender = font->parent_scale_x_distance (v: extents->ascender);
113 extents->descender = font->parent_scale_x_distance (v: extents->descender);
114 extents->line_gap = font->parent_scale_x_distance (v: extents->line_gap);
115 }
116 return ret;
117}

119static hb_bool_t
120hb_font_get_nominal_glyph_nil (hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
121 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
122 hb_codepoint_t unicode HB_UNUSED,
123 hb_codepoint_t *glyph,
124 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
125{
126 *glyph = 0;
127 return false;
128}
129
130static hb_bool_t
131hb_font_get_nominal_glyph_default (hb_font_t *font,
132 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
133 hb_codepoint_t unicode,
134 hb_codepoint_t *glyph,
135 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
136{
137 if (font->has_nominal_glyphs_func_set ())
138 {
139 return font->get_nominal_glyphs (count: 1, first_unicode: &unicode, unicode_stride: 0, first_glyph: glyph, glyph_stride: 0);
140 }
141 return font->parent->get_nominal_glyph (unicode, glyph);
142}
143
144#define hb_font_get_nominal_glyphs_nil hb_font_get_nominal_glyphs_default
145
146static unsigned int
147hb_font_get_nominal_glyphs_default (hb_font_t *font,
148 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
149 unsigned int count,
150 const hb_codepoint_t *first_unicode,
151 unsigned int unicode_stride,
152 hb_codepoint_t *first_glyph,
153 unsigned int glyph_stride,
154 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
155{
156 if (font->has_nominal_glyph_func_set ())
157 {
158 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
159 {
160 if (!font->get_nominal_glyph (unicode: *first_unicode, glyph: first_glyph))
161 return i;
162
163 first_unicode = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_codepoint_t> (P: first_unicode, offset: unicode_stride);
164 first_glyph = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_codepoint_t> (P: first_glyph, offset: glyph_stride);
165 }
166 return count;
167 }
168
169 return font->parent->get_nominal_glyphs (count,
170 first_unicode, unicode_stride,
171 first_glyph, glyph_stride);
172}

198static hb_position_t
199hb_font_get_glyph_h_advance_nil (hb_font_t *font,
200 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
201 hb_codepoint_t glyph HB_UNUSED,
202 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
203{
204 return font->x_scale;
205}
206
207static hb_position_t
208hb_font_get_glyph_h_advance_default (hb_font_t *font,
209 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
210 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
211 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
212{
213 if (font->has_glyph_h_advances_func_set ())
214 {
215 hb_position_t ret;
216 font->get_glyph_h_advances (count: 1, first_glyph: &glyph, glyph_stride: 0, first_advance: &ret, advance_stride: 0);
217 return ret;
218 }
219 return font->parent_scale_x_distance (v: font->parent->get_glyph_h_advance (glyph));
220}
221
222static hb_position_t
223hb_font_get_glyph_v_advance_nil (hb_font_t *font,
224 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
225 hb_codepoint_t glyph HB_UNUSED,
226 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
227{
228 /* TODO use font_extents.ascender+descender */
229 return font->y_scale;
230}
231
232static hb_position_t
233hb_font_get_glyph_v_advance_default (hb_font_t *font,
234 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
235 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
236 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
237{
238 if (font->has_glyph_v_advances_func_set ())
239 {
240 hb_position_t ret;
241 font->get_glyph_v_advances (count: 1, first_glyph: &glyph, glyph_stride: 0, first_advance: &ret, advance_stride: 0);
242 return ret;
243 }
244 return font->parent_scale_y_distance (v: font->parent->get_glyph_v_advance (glyph));
245}
246
247#define hb_font_get_glyph_h_advances_nil hb_font_get_glyph_h_advances_default
248
249static void
250hb_font_get_glyph_h_advances_default (hb_font_t* font,
251 void* font_data HB_UNUSED,
252 unsigned int count,
253 const hb_codepoint_t *first_glyph,
254 unsigned int glyph_stride,
255 hb_position_t *first_advance,
256 unsigned int advance_stride,
257 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
258{
259 if (font->has_glyph_h_advance_func_set ())
260 {
261 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
262 {
263 *first_advance = font->get_glyph_h_advance (glyph: *first_glyph);
264 first_glyph = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_codepoint_t> (P: first_glyph, offset: glyph_stride);
265 first_advance = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_position_t> (P: first_advance, offset: advance_stride);
266 }
267 return;
268 }
269
270 font->parent->get_glyph_h_advances (count,
271 first_glyph, glyph_stride,
272 first_advance, advance_stride);
273 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
274 {
275 *first_advance = font->parent_scale_x_distance (v: *first_advance);
276 first_advance = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_position_t> (P: first_advance, offset: advance_stride);
277 }
278}
279
280#define hb_font_get_glyph_v_advances_nil hb_font_get_glyph_v_advances_default
281static void
282hb_font_get_glyph_v_advances_default (hb_font_t* font,
283 void* font_data HB_UNUSED,
284 unsigned int count,
285 const hb_codepoint_t *first_glyph,
286 unsigned int glyph_stride,
287 hb_position_t *first_advance,
288 unsigned int advance_stride,
289 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
290{
291 if (font->has_glyph_v_advance_func_set ())
292 {
293 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
294 {
295 *first_advance = font->get_glyph_v_advance (glyph: *first_glyph);
296 first_glyph = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_codepoint_t> (P: first_glyph, offset: glyph_stride);
297 first_advance = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_position_t> (P: first_advance, offset: advance_stride);
298 }
299 return;
300 }
301
302 font->parent->get_glyph_v_advances (count,
303 first_glyph, glyph_stride,
304 first_advance, advance_stride);
305 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
306 {
307 *first_advance = font->parent_scale_y_distance (v: *first_advance);
308 first_advance = &StructAtOffsetUnaligned<hb_position_t> (P: first_advance, offset: advance_stride);
309 }
310}

312static hb_bool_t
313hb_font_get_glyph_h_origin_nil (hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
314 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
315 hb_codepoint_t glyph HB_UNUSED,
316 hb_position_t *x,
317 hb_position_t *y,
318 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
319{
320 *x = *y = 0;
321 return true;
322}
323
324static hb_bool_t
325hb_font_get_glyph_h_origin_default (hb_font_t *font,
326 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
327 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
328 hb_position_t *x,
329 hb_position_t *y,
330 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
331{
332 hb_bool_t ret = font->parent->get_glyph_h_origin (glyph, x, y);
333 if (ret)
334 font->parent_scale_position (x, y);
335 return ret;
336}

406static hb_bool_t
407hb_font_get_glyph_extents_nil (hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
408 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
409 hb_codepoint_t glyph HB_UNUSED,
410 hb_glyph_extents_t *extents,
411 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
412{
413 hb_memset (s: extents, c: 0, n: sizeof (*extents));
414 return false;
415}
416
417static hb_bool_t
418hb_font_get_glyph_extents_default (hb_font_t *font,
419 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
420 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
421 hb_glyph_extents_t *extents,
422 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
423{
424 hb_bool_t ret = font->parent->get_glyph_extents (glyph, extents);
425 if (ret) {
426 font->parent_scale_position (x: &extents->x_bearing, y: &extents->y_bearing);
427 font->parent_scale_distance (x: &extents->width, y: &extents->height);
428 }
429 return ret;
430}

445static hb_bool_t
446hb_font_get_glyph_contour_point_default (hb_font_t *font,
447 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
448 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
449 unsigned int point_index,
450 hb_position_t *x,

452 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
453{
454 hb_bool_t ret = font->parent->get_glyph_contour_point (glyph, point_index, x, y);
455 if (ret)
456 font->parent_scale_position (x, y);
457 return ret;
458}

460static hb_bool_t
461hb_font_get_glyph_name_nil (hb_font_t *font HB_UNUSED,
462 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
463 hb_codepoint_t glyph HB_UNUSED,
464 char *name,
465 unsigned int size,
466 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
467{
468 if (size) *name = '\0';
469 return false;
470}

527
528typedef struct hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t {
529 hb_draw_funcs_t *draw_funcs;
530 void *draw_data;
531 float x_scale;
532 float y_scale;
533 float slant;
534} hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t;
535
536static void
537hb_draw_move_to_default (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs HB_UNUSED,
538 void *draw_data,
539 hb_draw_state_t *st,
540 float to_x, float to_y,
541 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
542{
543 hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *adaptor = (hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *) draw_data;
544 float x_scale = adaptor->x_scale;
545 float y_scale = adaptor->y_scale;
546 float slant = adaptor->slant;
547
548 adaptor->draw_funcs->emit_move_to (draw_data: adaptor->draw_data, st&: *st,
549 to_x: x_scale * to_x + slant * to_y, to_y: y_scale * to_y);
550}
551
552static void
553hb_draw_line_to_default (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs HB_UNUSED, void *draw_data,
554 hb_draw_state_t *st,
555 float to_x, float to_y,
556 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
557{
558 hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *adaptor = (hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *) draw_data;
559 float x_scale = adaptor->x_scale;
560 float y_scale = adaptor->y_scale;
561 float slant = adaptor->slant;
562
563 st->current_x = st->current_x * x_scale + st->current_y * slant;
564 st->current_y = st->current_y * y_scale;
565
566 adaptor->draw_funcs->emit_line_to (draw_data: adaptor->draw_data, st&: *st,
567 to_x: x_scale * to_x + slant * to_y, to_y: y_scale * to_y);
568}
569
570static void
571hb_draw_quadratic_to_default (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs HB_UNUSED, void *draw_data,
572 hb_draw_state_t *st,
573 float control_x, float control_y,
574 float to_x, float to_y,
575 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
576{
577 hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *adaptor = (hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *) draw_data;
578 float x_scale = adaptor->x_scale;
579 float y_scale = adaptor->y_scale;
580 float slant = adaptor->slant;
581
582 st->current_x = st->current_x * x_scale + st->current_y * slant;
583 st->current_y = st->current_y * y_scale;
584
585 adaptor->draw_funcs->emit_quadratic_to (draw_data: adaptor->draw_data, st&: *st,
586 control_x: x_scale * control_x + slant * control_y, control_y: y_scale * control_y,
587 to_x: x_scale * to_x + slant * to_y, to_y: y_scale * to_y);
588}
589
590static void
591hb_draw_cubic_to_default (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs HB_UNUSED, void *draw_data,
592 hb_draw_state_t *st,
593 float control1_x, float control1_y,
594 float control2_x, float control2_y,
595 float to_x, float to_y,
596 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
597{
598 hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *adaptor = (hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *) draw_data;
599 float x_scale = adaptor->x_scale;
600 float y_scale = adaptor->y_scale;
601 float slant = adaptor->slant;
602
603 st->current_x = st->current_x * x_scale + st->current_y * slant;
604 st->current_y = st->current_y * y_scale;
605
606 adaptor->draw_funcs->emit_cubic_to (draw_data: adaptor->draw_data, st&: *st,
607 control1_x: x_scale * control1_x + slant * control1_y, control1_y: y_scale * control1_y,
608 control2_x: x_scale * control2_x + slant * control2_y, control2_y: y_scale * control2_y,
609 to_x: x_scale * to_x + slant * to_y, to_y: y_scale * to_y);
610}
611
612static void
613hb_draw_close_path_default (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs HB_UNUSED, void *draw_data,
614 hb_draw_state_t *st,
615 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
616{
617 hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *adaptor = (hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t *) draw_data;
618
619 adaptor->draw_funcs->emit_close_path (draw_data: adaptor->draw_data, st&: *st);
620}
621
622static const hb_draw_funcs_t _hb_draw_funcs_default = {
623 HB_OBJECT_HEADER_STATIC,
624
625 .func: {
626#define HB_DRAW_FUNC_IMPLEMENT(name) hb_draw_##name##_default,
627 HB_DRAW_FUNCS_IMPLEMENT_CALLBACKS
628#undef HB_DRAW_FUNC_IMPLEMENT
629 }
630};
631
632static void
633hb_font_draw_glyph_default (hb_font_t *font,
634 void *font_data HB_UNUSED,
635 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
636 hb_draw_funcs_t *draw_funcs,
637 void *draw_data,
638 void *user_data HB_UNUSED)
639{
640 hb_font_draw_glyph_default_adaptor_t adaptor = {
641 .draw_funcs: draw_funcs,
642 .draw_data: draw_data,
643 .x_scale: font->parent->x_scale ? (float) font->x_scale / (float) font->parent->x_scale : 0.f,
644 .y_scale: font->parent->y_scale ? (float) font->y_scale / (float) font->parent->y_scale : 0.f,
645 .slant: font->parent->y_scale ? (font->slant - font->parent->slant) *
646 (float) font->x_scale / (float) font->parent->y_scale : 0.f
647 };
648
649 font->parent->draw_glyph (glyph,
650 draw_funcs: const_cast<hb_draw_funcs_t *> (&_hb_draw_funcs_default),
651 draw_data: &adaptor);
652}
653
654static void
655hb_font_paint_glyph_default (hb_font_t *font,
656 void *font_data,
657 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
658 hb_paint_funcs_t *paint_funcs,
659 void *paint_data,
660 unsigned int palette,
661 hb_color_t foreground,
662 void *user_data)
663{
664 paint_funcs->push_transform (paint_data,
665 xx: font->parent->x_scale ? (float) font->x_scale / (float) font->parent->x_scale : 0.f,
666 yx: font->parent->y_scale ? (font->slant - font->parent->slant) *
667 (float) font->x_scale / (float) font->parent->y_scale : 0.f,
668 xy: 0.f,
669 yy: font->parent->y_scale ? (float) font->y_scale / (float) font->parent->y_scale : 0.f,
670 dx: 0.f, dy: 0.f);
671
672 font->parent->paint_glyph (glyph, paint_funcs, paint_data, palette, foreground);
673
674 paint_funcs->pop_transform (paint_data);
675}
676
677DEFINE_NULL_INSTANCE (hb_font_funcs_t) =
678{
679 HB_OBJECT_HEADER_STATIC,
680
681 .user_data: nullptr,
682 .destroy: nullptr,
683 .get: {
684 .f: {
685#define HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT(get_,name) hb_font_##get_##name##_nil,
686 HB_FONT_FUNCS_IMPLEMENT_CALLBACKS
687#undef HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT
688 }
689 }
690};
691
692static const hb_font_funcs_t _hb_font_funcs_default = {
693 HB_OBJECT_HEADER_STATIC,
694
695 .user_data: nullptr,
696 .destroy: nullptr,
697 .get: {
698 .f: {
699#define HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT(get_,name) hb_font_##get_##name##_default,
700 HB_FONT_FUNCS_IMPLEMENT_CALLBACKS
701#undef HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT
702 }
703 }
704};

707/**
708 * hb_font_funcs_create:
709 *
710 * Creates a new #hb_font_funcs_t structure of font functions.
711 *
712 * Return value: (transfer full): The font-functions structure
713 *
714 * Since: 0.9.2
715 **/
716hb_font_funcs_t *
717hb_font_funcs_create ()
718{
719 hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs;
720
721 if (!(ffuncs = hb_object_create<hb_font_funcs_t> ()))
722 return hb_font_funcs_get_empty ();
723
724 ffuncs->get = _hb_font_funcs_default.get;
725
726 return ffuncs;
727}
728
729/**
730 * hb_font_funcs_get_empty:
731 *
732 * Fetches an empty font-functions structure.
733 *
734 * Return value: (transfer full): The font-functions structure
735 *
736 * Since: 0.9.2
737 **/
738hb_font_funcs_t *
739hb_font_funcs_get_empty ()
740{
741 return const_cast<hb_font_funcs_t *> (&_hb_font_funcs_default);
742}
743
744/**
745 * hb_font_funcs_reference: (skip)
746 * @ffuncs: The font-functions structure
747 *
748 * Increases the reference count on a font-functions structure.
749 *
750 * Return value: The font-functions structure
751 *
752 * Since: 0.9.2
753 **/
754hb_font_funcs_t *
755hb_font_funcs_reference (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs)
756{
757 return hb_object_reference (obj: ffuncs);
758}
759
760/**
761 * hb_font_funcs_destroy: (skip)
762 * @ffuncs: The font-functions structure
763 *
764 * Decreases the reference count on a font-functions structure. When
765 * the reference count reaches zero, the font-functions structure is
766 * destroyed, freeing all memory.
767 *
768 * Since: 0.9.2
769 **/
770void
771hb_font_funcs_destroy (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs)
772{
773 if (!hb_object_destroy (obj: ffuncs)) return;
774
775 if (ffuncs->destroy)
776 {
777#define HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT(get_,name) if (ffuncs->destroy->name) \
778 ffuncs->destroy->name (!ffuncs->user_data ? nullptr : ffuncs->user_data->name);
779 HB_FONT_FUNCS_IMPLEMENT_CALLBACKS
780#undef HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT
781 }
782
783 hb_free (ptr: ffuncs->destroy);
784 hb_free (ptr: ffuncs->user_data);
785
786 hb_free (ptr: ffuncs);
787}
788
789/**
790 * hb_font_funcs_set_user_data: (skip)
791 * @ffuncs: The font-functions structure
792 * @key: The user-data key to set
793 * @data: A pointer to the user data set
794 * @destroy: (nullable): A callback to call when @data is not needed anymore
795 * @replace: Whether to replace an existing data with the same key
796 *
797 * Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the specified font-functions structure.
798 *
799 * Return value: `true` if success, `false` otherwise
800 *
801 * Since: 0.9.2
802 **/
803hb_bool_t
804hb_font_funcs_set_user_data (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs,
805 hb_user_data_key_t *key,
806 void * data,
807 hb_destroy_func_t destroy /* May be NULL. */,
808 hb_bool_t replace)
809{
810 return hb_object_set_user_data (obj: ffuncs, key, data, destroy, replace);
811}
812
813/**
814 * hb_font_funcs_get_user_data: (skip)

816 * @key: The user-data key to query

818 * Fetches the user data associated with the specified key,
819 * attached to the specified font-functions structure.

821 * Return value: (transfer none): A pointer to the user data
822 *
823 * Since: 0.9.2
824 **/
825void *
826hb_font_funcs_get_user_data (const hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs,
827 hb_user_data_key_t *key)
828{
829 return hb_object_get_user_data (obj: ffuncs, key);
830}

842hb_font_funcs_make_immutable (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs)

844 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: ffuncs))
845 return;
846
847 hb_object_make_immutable (obj: ffuncs);
848}

851 * hb_font_funcs_is_immutable:

865
866
867static bool
868_hb_font_funcs_set_preamble (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs,
869 bool func_is_null,
870 void **user_data,
871 hb_destroy_func_t *destroy)
872{
873 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: ffuncs))
874 {
875 if (*destroy)
876 (*destroy) (*user_data);
877 return false;
878 }
879
880 if (func_is_null)
881 {
882 if (*destroy)
883 (*destroy) (*user_data);
884 *destroy = nullptr;
885 *user_data = nullptr;
886 }
887
888 return true;
889}
890
891static bool
892_hb_font_funcs_set_middle (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs,
893 void *user_data,
894 hb_destroy_func_t destroy)
895{
896 if (user_data && !ffuncs->user_data)
897 {
898 ffuncs->user_data = (decltype (ffuncs->user_data)) hb_calloc (nmemb: 1, size: sizeof (*ffuncs->user_data));
899 if (unlikely (!ffuncs->user_data))
900 goto fail;
901 }
902 if (destroy && !ffuncs->destroy)
903 {
904 ffuncs->destroy = (decltype (ffuncs->destroy)) hb_calloc (nmemb: 1, size: sizeof (*ffuncs->destroy));
905 if (unlikely (!ffuncs->destroy))
906 goto fail;
907 }
908
909 return true;
910
911fail:
912 if (destroy)
913 (destroy) (user_data);
914 return false;
915}
916
917#define HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT(get_,name) \
918 \
919void \
920hb_font_funcs_set_##name##_func (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs, \
921 hb_font_##get_##name##_func_t func, \
922 void *user_data, \
923 hb_destroy_func_t destroy) \
924{ \
925 if (!_hb_font_funcs_set_preamble (ffuncs, !func, &user_data, &destroy))\
926 return; \
927 \
928 if (ffuncs->destroy && ffuncs->destroy->name) \
929 ffuncs->destroy->name (!ffuncs->user_data ? nullptr : ffuncs->user_data->name); \
930 \
931 if (!_hb_font_funcs_set_middle (ffuncs, user_data, destroy)) \
932 return; \
933 \
934 if (func) \
935 ffuncs->get.f.name = func; \
936 else \
937 ffuncs->get.f.name = hb_font_##get_##name##_default; \
938 \
939 if (ffuncs->user_data) \
940 ffuncs->user_data->name = user_data; \
941 if (ffuncs->destroy) \
942 ffuncs->destroy->name = destroy; \
943}
944
945HB_FONT_FUNCS_IMPLEMENT_CALLBACKS
946#undef HB_FONT_FUNC_IMPLEMENT
947
948bool
949hb_font_t::has_func_set (unsigned int i)
950{
951 return this->klass->get.array[i] != _hb_font_funcs_default.get.array[i];
952}
953
954bool
955hb_font_t::has_func (unsigned int i)
956{
957 return has_func_set (i) ||
958 (parent && parent != &_hb_Null_hb_font_t && parent->has_func (i));
959}

1000
1001/**
1002 * hb_font_get_glyph:
1003 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1004 * @unicode: The Unicode code point to query
1005 * @variation_selector: A variation-selector code point
1006 * @glyph: (out): The glyph ID retrieved
1007 *
1008 * Fetches the glyph ID for a Unicode code point in the specified
1009 * font, with an optional variation selector.
1010 *
1011 * If @variation_selector is 0, calls hb_font_get_nominal_glyph();
1012 * otherwise calls hb_font_get_variation_glyph().
1013 *
1014 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1015 *
1016 * Since: 0.9.2
1017 **/
1018hb_bool_t
1019hb_font_get_glyph (hb_font_t *font,
1020 hb_codepoint_t unicode,
1021 hb_codepoint_t variation_selector,
1022 hb_codepoint_t *glyph)
1023{
1024 if (unlikely (variation_selector))
1025 return font->get_variation_glyph (unicode, variation_selector, glyph);
1026 return font->get_nominal_glyph (unicode, glyph);
1027}
1028
1029/**
1030 * hb_font_get_nominal_glyph:
1031 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1032 * @unicode: The Unicode code point to query
1033 * @glyph: (out): The glyph ID retrieved
1034 *
1035 * Fetches the nominal glyph ID for a Unicode code point in the
1036 * specified font.
1037 *
1038 * This version of the function should not be used to fetch glyph IDs
1039 * for code points modified by variation selectors. For variation-selector
1040 * support, user hb_font_get_variation_glyph() or use hb_font_get_glyph().
1041 *
1042 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1043 *
1044 * Since: 1.2.3
1045 **/
1046hb_bool_t
1047hb_font_get_nominal_glyph (hb_font_t *font,
1048 hb_codepoint_t unicode,
1049 hb_codepoint_t *glyph)
1050{
1051 return font->get_nominal_glyph (unicode, glyph);
1052}
1053
1054/**
1055 * hb_font_get_nominal_glyphs:
1056 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1057 * @count: number of code points to query
1058 * @first_unicode: The first Unicode code point to query
1059 * @unicode_stride: The stride between successive code points
1060 * @first_glyph: (out): The first glyph ID retrieved
1061 * @glyph_stride: The stride between successive glyph IDs
1062 *
1063 * Fetches the nominal glyph IDs for a sequence of Unicode code points. Glyph
1064 * IDs must be returned in a #hb_codepoint_t output parameter. Stopes at the
1065 * first unsupported glyph ID.
1066 *
1067 * Return value: the number of code points processed
1068 *
1069 * Since: 2.6.3
1070 **/
1071unsigned int
1072hb_font_get_nominal_glyphs (hb_font_t *font,
1073 unsigned int count,
1074 const hb_codepoint_t *first_unicode,
1075 unsigned int unicode_stride,
1076 hb_codepoint_t *first_glyph,
1077 unsigned int glyph_stride)
1078{
1079 return font->get_nominal_glyphs (count,
1080 first_unicode, unicode_stride,
1081 first_glyph, glyph_stride);
1082}
1083
1084/**
1085 * hb_font_get_variation_glyph:
1086 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1087 * @unicode: The Unicode code point to query
1088 * @variation_selector: The variation-selector code point to query
1089 * @glyph: (out): The glyph ID retrieved
1090 *
1091 * Fetches the glyph ID for a Unicode code point when followed by
1092 * by the specified variation-selector code point, in the specified
1093 * font.
1094 *
1095 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1096 *
1097 * Since: 1.2.3
1098 **/
1099hb_bool_t
1100hb_font_get_variation_glyph (hb_font_t *font,
1101 hb_codepoint_t unicode,
1102 hb_codepoint_t variation_selector,
1103 hb_codepoint_t *glyph)
1104{
1105 return font->get_variation_glyph (unicode, variation_selector, glyph);
1106}

1248 * the specified font, for horizontal text segments.

1263}

1292/**
1293 * hb_font_get_glyph_extents:
1294 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1295 * @glyph: The glyph ID to query
1296 * @extents: (out): The #hb_glyph_extents_t retrieved
1297 *
1298 * Fetches the #hb_glyph_extents_t data for a glyph ID
1299 * in the specified font.
1300 *
1301 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1302 *
1303 * Since: 0.9.2
1304 **/
1305hb_bool_t
1306hb_font_get_glyph_extents (hb_font_t *font,
1307 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
1308 hb_glyph_extents_t *extents)
1309{
1310 return font->get_glyph_extents (glyph, extents);
1311}

1707/**
1708 * hb_font_glyph_to_string:
1709 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1710 * @glyph: The glyph ID to query
1711 * @s: (out) (array length=size): The string containing the glyph name
1712 * @size: Length of string @s
1713 *
1714 * Fetches the name of the specified glyph ID in @font and returns
1715 * it in string @s.
1716 *
1717 * If the glyph ID has no name in @font, a string of the form `gidDDD` is
1718 * generated, with `DDD` being the glyph ID.
1719 *
1720 * According to the OpenType specification, glyph names are limited to 63
1721 * characters and can only contain (a subset of) ASCII.
1722 *
1723 * Since: 0.9.2
1724 **/
1725void
1726hb_font_glyph_to_string (hb_font_t *font,
1727 hb_codepoint_t glyph,
1728 char *s,
1729 unsigned int size)
1730{
1731 font->glyph_to_string (glyph, s, size);
1732}
1733
1734/**
1735 * hb_font_glyph_from_string:
1736 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1737 * @s: (array length=len) (element-type uint8_t): string to query
1738 * @len: The length of the string @s
1739 * @glyph: (out): The glyph ID corresponding to the string requested
1740 *
1741 * Fetches the glyph ID from @font that matches the specified string.
1742 * Strings of the format `gidDDD` or `uniUUUU` are parsed automatically.
1743 *
1744 * <note>Note: @len == -1 means the string is null-terminated.</note>
1745 *
1746 * Return value: `true` if data found, `false` otherwise
1747 *
1748 * Since: 0.9.2
1749 **/
1750hb_bool_t
1751hb_font_glyph_from_string (hb_font_t *font,
1752 const char *s,
1753 int len,
1754 hb_codepoint_t *glyph)
1755{
1756 return font->glyph_from_string (s, len, glyph);
1757}

1759
1760/*
1761 * hb_font_t
1762 */
1763
1764DEFINE_NULL_INSTANCE (hb_font_t) =
1765{
1766 HB_OBJECT_HEADER_STATIC,
1767
1768 .serial: 0, /* serial */
1769 .serial_coords: 0, /* serial_coords */
1770
1771 .parent: nullptr, /* parent */
1772 .face: const_cast<hb_face_t *> (&_hb_Null_hb_face_t),
1773
1774 .x_scale: 1000, /* x_scale */
1775 .y_scale: 1000, /* y_scale */
1776 .x_embolden: 0.f, /* x_embolden */
1777 .y_embolden: 0.f, /* y_embolden */
1778 .embolden_in_place: true, /* embolden_in_place */
1779 .x_strength: 0, /* x_strength */
1780 .y_strength: 0, /* y_strength */
1781 .slant: 0.f, /* slant */
1782 .slant_xy: 0.f, /* slant_xy; */
1783 .x_multf: 1.f, /* x_multf */
1784 .y_multf: 1.f, /* y_multf */
1785 .x_mult: 1<<16, /* x_mult */
1786 .y_mult: 1<<16, /* y_mult */
1787
1788 .x_ppem: 0, /* x_ppem */
1789 .y_ppem: 0, /* y_ppem */
1790 .ptem: 0, /* ptem */
1791
1792 HB_FONT_NO_VAR_NAMED_INSTANCE, /* instance_index */
1793 .num_coords: 0, /* num_coords */
1794 .coords: nullptr, /* coords */
1795 .design_coords: nullptr, /* design_coords */
1796
1797 .klass: const_cast<hb_font_funcs_t *> (&_hb_Null_hb_font_funcs_t),
1798
1799 /* Zero for the rest is fine. */
1800};
1801
1802
1803static hb_font_t *
1804_hb_font_create (hb_face_t *face)
1805{
1806 hb_font_t *font;
1807
1808 if (unlikely (!face))
1809 face = hb_face_get_empty ();
1810
1811 if (!(font = hb_object_create<hb_font_t> ()))
1812 return hb_font_get_empty ();
1813
1814 hb_face_make_immutable (face);
1815 font->parent = hb_font_get_empty ();
1816 font->face = hb_face_reference (face);
1817 font->klass = hb_font_funcs_get_empty ();
1818 font->data.init0 (parent_data: font);
1819 font->x_scale = font->y_scale = face->get_upem ();
1820 font->embolden_in_place = true;
1821 font->x_multf = font->y_multf = 1.f;
1822 font->x_mult = font->y_mult = 1 << 16;
1823 font->instance_index = HB_FONT_NO_VAR_NAMED_INSTANCE;
1824
1825 return font;
1826}
1827
1828/**
1829 * hb_font_create:
1830 * @face: a face.
1831 *
1832 * Constructs a new font object from the specified face.
1833 *
1834 * <note>Note: If @face's index value (as passed to hb_face_create()
1835 * has non-zero top 16-bits, those bits minus one are passed to
1836 * hb_font_set_var_named_instance(), effectively loading a named-instance
1837 * of a variable font, instead of the default-instance. This allows
1838 * specifying which named-instance to load by default when creating the
1839 * face.</note>
1840 *
1841 * Return value: (transfer full): The new font object
1842 *
1843 * Since: 0.9.2
1844 **/
1845hb_font_t *
1846hb_font_create (hb_face_t *face)
1847{
1848 hb_font_t *font = _hb_font_create (face);
1849
1850#ifndef HB_NO_OT_FONT
1851 /* Install our in-house, very lightweight, funcs. */
1852 hb_ot_font_set_funcs (font);
1853#endif
1854
1855#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
1856 if (face && face->index >> 16)
1857 hb_font_set_var_named_instance (font, instance_index: (face->index >> 16) - 1);
1858#endif
1859
1860 return font;
1861}
1862
1863static void
1864_hb_font_adopt_var_coords (hb_font_t *font,
1865 int *coords, /* 2.14 normalized */
1866 float *design_coords,
1867 unsigned int coords_length)
1868{
1869 hb_free (ptr: font->coords);
1870 hb_free (ptr: font->design_coords);
1871
1872 font->coords = coords;
1873 font->design_coords = design_coords;
1874 font->num_coords = coords_length;
1875
1876 font->mults_changed (); // Easiest to call this to drop cached data
1877}
1878
1879/**
1880 * hb_font_create_sub_font:
1881 * @parent: The parent font object
1882 *
1883 * Constructs a sub-font font object from the specified @parent font,
1884 * replicating the parent's properties.
1885 *
1886 * Return value: (transfer full): The new sub-font font object
1887 *
1888 * Since: 0.9.2
1889 **/
1890hb_font_t *
1891hb_font_create_sub_font (hb_font_t *parent)
1892{
1893 if (unlikely (!parent))
1894 parent = hb_font_get_empty ();
1895
1896 hb_font_t *font = _hb_font_create (face: parent->face);
1897
1898 if (unlikely (hb_object_is_immutable (font)))
1899 return font;
1900
1901 font->parent = hb_font_reference (font: parent);
1902
1903 font->x_scale = parent->x_scale;
1904 font->y_scale = parent->y_scale;
1905 font->x_embolden = parent->x_embolden;
1906 font->y_embolden = parent->y_embolden;
1907 font->embolden_in_place = parent->embolden_in_place;
1908 font->slant = parent->slant;
1909 font->x_ppem = parent->x_ppem;
1910 font->y_ppem = parent->y_ppem;
1911 font->ptem = parent->ptem;
1912
1913 unsigned int num_coords = parent->num_coords;
1914 if (num_coords)
1915 {
1916 int *coords = (int *) hb_calloc (nmemb: num_coords, size: sizeof (parent->coords[0]));
1917 float *design_coords = (float *) hb_calloc (nmemb: num_coords, size: sizeof (parent->design_coords[0]));
1918 if (likely (coords && design_coords))
1919 {
1920 hb_memcpy (dst: coords, src: parent->coords, len: num_coords * sizeof (parent->coords[0]));
1921 hb_memcpy (dst: design_coords, src: parent->design_coords, len: num_coords * sizeof (parent->design_coords[0]));
1922 _hb_font_adopt_var_coords (font, coords, design_coords, coords_length: num_coords);
1923 }
1924 else
1925 {
1926 hb_free (ptr: coords);
1927 hb_free (ptr: design_coords);
1928 }
1929 }
1930
1931 font->mults_changed ();
1932
1933 return font;
1934}

1945hb_font_t *
1946hb_font_get_empty ()
1947{

1957 * Return value: (transfer full): The @font object
1958 *
1959 * Since: 0.9.2

1965}
1966
1967/**
1968 * hb_font_destroy: (skip)
1969 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1970 *
1971 * Decreases the reference count on the given font object. When the
1972 * reference count reaches zero, the font is destroyed,
1973 * freeing all memory.
1974 *
1975 * Since: 0.9.2
1976 **/
1977void
1978hb_font_destroy (hb_font_t *font)
1979{
1980 if (!hb_object_destroy (obj: font)) return;
1981
1982 font->data.fini ();
1983
1984 if (font->destroy)
1985 font->destroy (font->user_data);
1986
1987 hb_font_destroy (font: font->parent);
1988 hb_face_destroy (face: font->face);
1989 hb_font_funcs_destroy (ffuncs: font->klass);
1990
1991 hb_free (ptr: font->coords);
1992 hb_free (ptr: font->design_coords);
1993
1994 hb_free (ptr: font);
1995}

1998 * hb_font_set_user_data: (skip)
1999 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2000 * @key: The user-data key

2002 * @destroy: (nullable): A callback to call when @data is not needed anymore
2003 * @replace: Whether to replace an existing data with the same key
2004 *
2005 * Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the specified font object.

2007 * Return value: `true` if success, `false` otherwise
2008 *
2009 * Since: 0.9.2
2010 **/

2012hb_font_set_user_data (hb_font_t *font,
2013 hb_user_data_key_t *key,
2014 void * data,
2015 hb_destroy_func_t destroy /* May be NULL. */,
2016 hb_bool_t replace)
2017{
2018 if (!hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2019 font->serial++;
2020
2021 return hb_object_set_user_data (obj: font, key, data, destroy, replace);
2022}

2219 * @font_data: Data to attach to @font
2220 * @destroy: (nullable): The function to call when @font_data is not needed anymore
2221 *
2222 * Replaces the font-functions structure attached to a font, updating
2223 * the font's user-data with @font-data and the @destroy callback.
2224 *
2225 * Since: 0.9.2

2228hb_font_set_funcs (hb_font_t *font,
2229 hb_font_funcs_t *klass,
2230 void *font_data,
2231 hb_destroy_func_t destroy /* May be NULL. */)
2232{
2233 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2234 {
2235 if (destroy)
2236 destroy (font_data);
2237 return;
2238 }
2239
2240 font->serial++;
2241
2242 if (font->destroy)
2243 font->destroy (font->user_data);
2244
2245 if (!klass)
2246 klass = hb_font_funcs_get_empty ();
2247
2248 hb_font_funcs_reference (ffuncs: klass);
2249 hb_font_funcs_destroy (ffuncs: font->klass);
2250 font->klass = klass;
2251 font->user_data = font_data;
2252 font->destroy = destroy;
2253}

2273 {
2274 if (destroy)
2275 destroy (font_data);
2276 return;

2280

2282 font->destroy (font->user_data);
2283

2285 font->destroy = destroy;

2288
2289/**
2290 * hb_font_set_scale:
2291 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2292 * @x_scale: Horizontal scale value to assign
2293 * @y_scale: Vertical scale value to assign
2294 *
2295 * Sets the horizontal and vertical scale of a font.
2296 *
2297 * The font scale is a number related to, but not the same as,
2298 * font size. Typically the client establishes a scale factor
2299 * to be used between the two. For example, 64, or 256, which
2300 * would be the fractional-precision part of the font scale.
2301 * This is necessary because #hb_position_t values are integer
2302 * types and you need to leave room for fractional values
2303 * in there.
2304 *
2305 * For example, to set the font size to 20, with 64
2306 * levels of fractional precision you would call
2307 * `hb_font_set_scale(font, 20 * 64, 20 * 64)`.
2308 *
2309 * In the example above, even what font size 20 means is up to
2310 * you. It might be 20 pixels, or 20 points, or 20 millimeters.
2311 * HarfBuzz does not care about that. You can set the point
2312 * size of the font using hb_font_set_ptem(), and the pixel
2313 * size using hb_font_set_ppem().
2314 *
2315 * The choice of scale is yours but needs to be consistent between
2316 * what you set here, and what you expect out of #hb_position_t
2317 * as well has draw / paint API output values.
2318 *
2319 * Fonts default to a scale equal to the UPEM value of their face.
2320 * A font with this setting is sometimes called an "unscaled" font.
2321 *
2322 * Since: 0.9.2
2323 **/
2324void
2325hb_font_set_scale (hb_font_t *font,
2326 int x_scale,
2327 int y_scale)
2328{
2329 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2330 return;
2331
2332 if (font->x_scale == x_scale && font->y_scale == y_scale)
2333 return;
2334
2335 font->serial++;
2336
2337 font->x_scale = x_scale;
2338 font->y_scale = y_scale;
2339 font->mults_changed ();
2340}
2341
2342/**
2343 * hb_font_get_scale:
2344 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2345 * @x_scale: (out): Horizontal scale value
2346 * @y_scale: (out): Vertical scale value
2347 *
2348 * Fetches the horizontal and vertical scale of a font.
2349 *
2350 * Since: 0.9.2
2351 **/
2352void
2353hb_font_get_scale (hb_font_t *font,
2354 int *x_scale,
2355 int *y_scale)
2356{
2357 if (x_scale) *x_scale = font->x_scale;
2358 if (y_scale) *y_scale = font->y_scale;
2359}
2360
2361/**
2362 * hb_font_set_ppem:
2363 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2364 * @x_ppem: Horizontal ppem value to assign
2365 * @y_ppem: Vertical ppem value to assign
2366 *
2367 * Sets the horizontal and vertical pixels-per-em (PPEM) of a font.
2368 *
2369 * These values are used for pixel-size-specific adjustment to
2370 * shaping and draw results, though for the most part they are
2371 * unused and can be left unset.
2372 *
2373 * Since: 0.9.2
2374 **/
2375void
2376hb_font_set_ppem (hb_font_t *font,
2377 unsigned int x_ppem,
2378 unsigned int y_ppem)
2379{
2380 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2381 return;
2382
2383 if (font->x_ppem == x_ppem && font->y_ppem == y_ppem)
2384 return;
2385
2386 font->serial++;
2387
2388 font->x_ppem = x_ppem;
2389 font->y_ppem = y_ppem;
2390}
2391
2392/**
2393 * hb_font_get_ppem:
2394 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2395 * @x_ppem: (out): Horizontal ppem value
2396 * @y_ppem: (out): Vertical ppem value
2397 *
2398 * Fetches the horizontal and vertical points-per-em (ppem) of a font.
2399 *
2400 * Since: 0.9.2
2401 **/
2402void
2403hb_font_get_ppem (hb_font_t *font,
2404 unsigned int *x_ppem,
2405 unsigned int *y_ppem)
2406{
2407 if (x_ppem) *x_ppem = font->x_ppem;
2408 if (y_ppem) *y_ppem = font->y_ppem;
2409}

2416 * Sets the "point size" of a font. Set to zero to unset.

2455/**
2456 * hb_font_set_synthetic_bold:
2457 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2458 * @x_embolden: the amount to embolden horizontally
2459 * @y_embolden: the amount to embolden vertically
2460 * @in_place: whether to embolden glyphs in-place
2461 *
2462 * Sets the "synthetic boldness" of a font.
2463 *
2464 * Positive values for @x_embolden / @y_embolden make a font
2465 * bolder, negative values thinner. Typical values are in the
2466 * 0.01 to 0.05 range. The default value is zero.
2467 *
2468 * Synthetic boldness is applied by offsetting the contour
2469 * points of the glyph shape.
2470 *
2471 * Synthetic boldness is applied when rendering a glyph via
2472 * hb_font_draw_glyph().
2473 *
2474 * If @in_place is `false`, then glyph advance-widths are also
2475 * adjusted, otherwise they are not. The in-place mode is
2476 * useful for simulating [font grading](https://fonts.google.com/knowledge/glossary/grade).
2477 *
2478 *
2479 * Since: 7.0.0
2480 **/
2481void
2482hb_font_set_synthetic_bold (hb_font_t *font,
2483 float x_embolden,
2484 float y_embolden,
2485 hb_bool_t in_place)
2486{
2487 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2488 return;
2489
2490 if (font->x_embolden == x_embolden &&
2491 font->y_embolden == y_embolden &&
2492 font->embolden_in_place == (bool) in_place)
2493 return;
2494
2495 font->serial++;
2496
2497 font->x_embolden = x_embolden;
2498 font->y_embolden = y_embolden;
2499 font->embolden_in_place = in_place;
2500 font->mults_changed ();
2501}
2502
2503/**
2504 * hb_font_get_synthetic_bold:
2505 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2506 * @x_embolden: (out): return location for horizontal value
2507 * @y_embolden: (out): return location for vertical value
2508 * @in_place: (out): return location for in-place value
2509 *
2510 * Fetches the "synthetic boldness" parameters of a font.
2511 *
2512 * Since: 7.0.0
2513 **/
2514void
2515hb_font_get_synthetic_bold (hb_font_t *font,
2516 float *x_embolden,
2517 float *y_embolden,
2518 hb_bool_t *in_place)
2519{
2520 if (x_embolden) *x_embolden = font->x_embolden;
2521 if (y_embolden) *y_embolden = font->y_embolden;
2522 if (in_place) *in_place = font->embolden_in_place;
2523}
2524
2525/**
2526 * hb_font_set_synthetic_slant:
2527 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2528 * @slant: synthetic slant value.
2529 *
2530 * Sets the "synthetic slant" of a font. By default is zero.
2531 * Synthetic slant is the graphical skew applied to the font
2532 * at rendering time.
2533 *
2534 * HarfBuzz needs to know this value to adjust shaping results,
2535 * metrics, and style values to match the slanted rendering.
2536 *
2537 * <note>Note: The glyph shape fetched via the hb_font_draw_glyph()
2538 * function is slanted to reflect this value as well.</note>
2539 *
2540 * <note>Note: The slant value is a ratio. For example, a
2541 * 20% slant would be represented as a 0.2 value.</note>
2542 *
2543 * Since: 3.3.0
2544 **/
2545HB_EXTERN void
2546hb_font_set_synthetic_slant (hb_font_t *font, float slant)
2547{
2548 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2549 return;
2550
2551 if (font->slant == slant)
2552 return;
2553
2554 font->serial++;
2555
2556 font->slant = slant;
2557 font->mults_changed ();
2558}
2559
2560/**
2561 * hb_font_get_synthetic_slant:
2562 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2563 *
2564 * Fetches the "synthetic slant" of a font.
2565 *
2566 * Return value: Synthetic slant. By default is zero.
2567 *
2568 * Since: 3.3.0
2569 **/
2570HB_EXTERN float
2571hb_font_get_synthetic_slant (hb_font_t *font)
2572{
2573 return font->slant;
2574}
2575
2576#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
2577/*
2578 * Variations
2579 */
2580
2581/**
2582 * hb_font_set_variations:
2583 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2584 * @variations: (array length=variations_length): Array of variation settings to apply
2585 * @variations_length: Number of variations to apply
2586 *
2587 * Applies a list of font-variation settings to a font.
2588 *
2589 * Note that this overrides all existing variations set on @font.
2590 * Axes not included in @variations will be effectively set to their
2591 * default values.
2592 *
2593 * Since: 1.4.2
2594 */
2595void
2596hb_font_set_variations (hb_font_t *font,
2597 const hb_variation_t *variations,
2598 unsigned int variations_length)
2599{
2600 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2601 return;
2602
2603 font->serial_coords = ++font->serial;
2604
2605 if (!variations_length && font->instance_index == HB_FONT_NO_VAR_NAMED_INSTANCE)
2606 {
2607 hb_font_set_var_coords_normalized (font, coords: nullptr, coords_length: 0);
2608 return;
2609 }
2610
2611 const OT::fvar &fvar = *font->face->table.fvar;
2612 auto axes = fvar.get_axes ();
2613 const unsigned coords_length = axes.length;
2614
2615 int *normalized = coords_length ? (int *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (int)) : nullptr;
2616 float *design_coords = coords_length ? (float *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (float)) : nullptr;
2617
2618 if (unlikely (coords_length && !(normalized && design_coords)))
2619 {
2620 hb_free (ptr: normalized);
2621 hb_free (ptr: design_coords);
2622 return;
2623 }
2624
2625 /* Initialize design coords. */
2626 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < coords_length; i++)
2627 design_coords[i] = axes[i].get_default ();
2628 if (font->instance_index != HB_FONT_NO_VAR_NAMED_INSTANCE)
2629 {
2630 unsigned count = coords_length;
2631 /* This may fail if index is out-of-range;
2632 * That's why we initialize design_coords from fvar above
2633 * unconditionally. */
2634 hb_ot_var_named_instance_get_design_coords (face: font->face, instance_index: font->instance_index,
2635 coords_length: &count, coords: design_coords);
2636 }
2637
2638 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < variations_length; i++)
2639 {
2640 const auto tag = variations[i].tag;
2641 const auto v = variations[i].value;
2642 for (unsigned axis_index = 0; axis_index < coords_length; axis_index++)
2643 if (axes[axis_index].axisTag == tag)
2644 design_coords[axis_index] = v;
2645 }
2646 font->face->table.avar->map_coords (coords: normalized, coords_length);
2647
2648 hb_ot_var_normalize_coords (face: font->face, coords_length, design_coords, normalized_coords: normalized);
2649 _hb_font_adopt_var_coords (font, coords: normalized, design_coords, coords_length);
2650}
2651
2652/**
2653 * hb_font_set_var_coords_design:
2654 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2655 * @coords: (array length=coords_length): Array of variation coordinates to apply
2656 * @coords_length: Number of coordinates to apply
2657 *
2658 * Applies a list of variation coordinates (in design-space units)
2659 * to a font.
2660 *
2661 * Note that this overrides all existing variations set on @font.
2662 * Axes not included in @coords will be effectively set to their
2663 * default values.
2664 *
2665 * Since: 1.4.2
2666 */
2667void
2668hb_font_set_var_coords_design (hb_font_t *font,
2669 const float *coords,
2670 unsigned int coords_length)
2671{
2672 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2673 return;
2674
2675 font->serial_coords = ++font->serial;
2676
2677 int *normalized = coords_length ? (int *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (int)) : nullptr;
2678 float *design_coords = coords_length ? (float *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (float)) : nullptr;
2679
2680 if (unlikely (coords_length && !(normalized && design_coords)))
2681 {
2682 hb_free (ptr: normalized);
2683 hb_free (ptr: design_coords);
2684 return;
2685 }
2686
2687 if (coords_length)
2688 hb_memcpy (dst: design_coords, src: coords, len: coords_length * sizeof (font->design_coords[0]));
2689
2690 hb_ot_var_normalize_coords (face: font->face, coords_length, design_coords: coords, normalized_coords: normalized);
2691 _hb_font_adopt_var_coords (font, coords: normalized, design_coords, coords_length);
2692}
2693
2694/**
2695 * hb_font_set_var_named_instance:
2696 * @font: a font.
2697 * @instance_index: named instance index.
2698 *
2699 * Sets design coords of a font from a named-instance index.
2700 *
2701 * Since: 2.6.0
2702 */
2703void
2704hb_font_set_var_named_instance (hb_font_t *font,
2705 unsigned int instance_index)
2706{
2707 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2708 return;
2709
2710 if (font->instance_index == instance_index)
2711 return;
2712
2713 font->serial_coords = ++font->serial;
2714
2715 font->instance_index = instance_index;
2716 hb_font_set_variations (font, variations: nullptr, variations_length: 0);
2717}

2720 * hb_font_get_var_named_instance:

2726 *
2727 * Since: 7.0.0
2728 **/
2729unsigned int
2730hb_font_get_var_named_instance (hb_font_t *font)

2733}
2734
2735/**
2736 * hb_font_set_var_coords_normalized:
2737 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2738 * @coords: (array length=coords_length): Array of variation coordinates to apply
2739 * @coords_length: Number of coordinates to apply
2740 *
2741 * Applies a list of variation coordinates (in normalized units)
2742 * to a font.
2743 *
2744 * Note that this overrides all existing variations set on @font.
2745 * Axes not included in @coords will be effectively set to their
2746 * default values.
2747 *
2748 * <note>Note: Coordinates should be normalized to 2.14.</note>
2749 *
2750 * Since: 1.4.2
2751 */
2752void
2753hb_font_set_var_coords_normalized (hb_font_t *font,
2754 const int *coords, /* 2.14 normalized */
2755 unsigned int coords_length)
2756{
2757 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: font))
2758 return;
2759
2760 font->serial_coords = ++font->serial;
2761
2762 int *copy = coords_length ? (int *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (coords[0])) : nullptr;
2763 int *unmapped = coords_length ? (int *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (coords[0])) : nullptr;
2764 float *design_coords = coords_length ? (float *) hb_calloc (nmemb: coords_length, size: sizeof (design_coords[0])) : nullptr;
2765
2766 if (unlikely (coords_length && !(copy && unmapped && design_coords)))
2767 {
2768 hb_free (ptr: copy);
2769 hb_free (ptr: unmapped);
2770 hb_free (ptr: design_coords);
2771 return;
2772 }
2773
2774 if (coords_length)
2775 {
2776 hb_memcpy (dst: copy, src: coords, len: coords_length * sizeof (coords[0]));
2777 hb_memcpy (dst: unmapped, src: coords, len: coords_length * sizeof (coords[0]));
2778 }
2779
2780 /* Best effort design coords simulation */
2781 font->face->table.avar->unmap_coords (coords: unmapped, coords_length);
2782 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < coords_length; ++i)
2783 design_coords[i] = font->face->table.fvar->unnormalize_axis_value (axis_index: i, v: unmapped[i]);
2784 hb_free (ptr: unmapped);
2785
2786 _hb_font_adopt_var_coords (font, coords: copy, design_coords, coords_length);
2787}
2788
2789/**
2790 * hb_font_get_var_coords_normalized:
2791 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
2792 * @length: (out): Number of coordinates retrieved
2793 *
2794 * Fetches the list of normalized variation coordinates currently
2795 * set on a font.
2796 *
2797 * Note that this returned array may only contain values for some
2798 * (or none) of the axes; omitted axes effectively have zero values.
2799 *
2800 * Return value is valid as long as variation coordinates of the font
2801 * are not modified.
2802 *
2803 * Return value: coordinates array
2804 *
2805 * Since: 1.4.2
2806 */
2807const int *
2808hb_font_get_var_coords_normalized (hb_font_t *font,
2809 unsigned int *length)
2810{
2811 if (length)
2812 *length = font->num_coords;
2813
2814 return font->coords;
2815}

2818 * hb_font_get_var_coords_design:

2837hb_font_get_var_coords_design (hb_font_t *font,

2841 *length = font->num_coords;

2844}

2847#ifndef HB_DISABLE_DEPRECATED
2848/*
2849 * Deprecated get_glyph_func():
2850 */
2851
2852struct hb_trampoline_closure_t
2853{
2854 void *user_data;
2855 hb_destroy_func_t destroy;
2856 unsigned int ref_count;
2857};
2858
2859template <typename FuncType>
2860struct hb_trampoline_t
2861{
2862 hb_trampoline_closure_t closure; /* Must be first. */
2863 FuncType func;
2864};
2865
2866template <typename FuncType>
2867static hb_trampoline_t<FuncType> *
2868trampoline_create (FuncType func,
2869 void *user_data,
2870 hb_destroy_func_t destroy)
2871{
2872 typedef hb_trampoline_t<FuncType> trampoline_t;
2873
2874 trampoline_t *trampoline = (trampoline_t *) hb_calloc (nmemb: 1, size: sizeof (trampoline_t));
2875
2876 if (unlikely (!trampoline))
2877 return nullptr;
2878
2879 trampoline->closure.user_data = user_data;
2880 trampoline->closure.destroy = destroy;
2881 trampoline->closure.ref_count = 1;
2882 trampoline->func = func;
2883
2884 return trampoline;
2885}
2886
2887static void
2888trampoline_reference (hb_trampoline_closure_t *closure)
2889{
2890 closure->ref_count++;
2891}
2892
2893static void
2894trampoline_destroy (void *user_data)
2895{
2896 hb_trampoline_closure_t *closure = (hb_trampoline_closure_t *) user_data;
2897
2898 if (--closure->ref_count)
2899 return;
2900
2901 if (closure->destroy)
2902 closure->destroy (closure->user_data);
2903 hb_free (ptr: closure);
2904}
2905
2906typedef hb_trampoline_t<hb_font_get_glyph_func_t> hb_font_get_glyph_trampoline_t;
2907
2908static hb_bool_t
2909hb_font_get_nominal_glyph_trampoline (hb_font_t *font,
2910 void *font_data,
2911 hb_codepoint_t unicode,
2912 hb_codepoint_t *glyph,
2913 void *user_data)
2914{
2915 hb_font_get_glyph_trampoline_t *trampoline = (hb_font_get_glyph_trampoline_t *) user_data;
2916 return trampoline->func (font, font_data, unicode, 0, glyph, trampoline->closure.user_data);
2917}
2918
2919static hb_bool_t
2920hb_font_get_variation_glyph_trampoline (hb_font_t *font,
2921 void *font_data,
2922 hb_codepoint_t unicode,
2923 hb_codepoint_t variation_selector,
2924 hb_codepoint_t *glyph,
2925 void *user_data)
2926{
2927 hb_font_get_glyph_trampoline_t *trampoline = (hb_font_get_glyph_trampoline_t *) user_data;
2928 return trampoline->func (font, font_data, unicode, variation_selector, glyph, trampoline->closure.user_data);
2929}
2930
2931/**
2932 * hb_font_funcs_set_glyph_func:
2933 * @ffuncs: The font-functions structure
2934 * @func: (closure user_data) (destroy destroy) (scope notified): callback function
2935 * @user_data: data to pass to @func
2936 * @destroy: (nullable): function to call when @user_data is not needed anymore
2937 *
2938 * Deprecated. Use hb_font_funcs_set_nominal_glyph_func() and
2939 * hb_font_funcs_set_variation_glyph_func() instead.
2940 *
2941 * Since: 0.9.2
2942 * Deprecated: 1.2.3
2943 **/
2944void
2945hb_font_funcs_set_glyph_func (hb_font_funcs_t *ffuncs,
2946 hb_font_get_glyph_func_t func,
2947 void *user_data,
2948 hb_destroy_func_t destroy /* May be NULL. */)
2949{
2950 if (hb_object_is_immutable (obj: ffuncs))
2951 {
2952 if (destroy)
2953 destroy (user_data);
2954 return;
2955 }
2956
2957 hb_font_get_glyph_trampoline_t *trampoline;
2958
2959 trampoline = trampoline_create (func, user_data, destroy);
2960 if (unlikely (!trampoline))
2961 {
2962 if (destroy)
2963 destroy (user_data);
2964 return;
2965 }
2966
2967 /* Since we pass it to two destroying functions. */
2968 trampoline_reference (closure: &trampoline->closure);
2969
2970 hb_font_funcs_set_nominal_glyph_func (ffuncs,
2971 func: hb_font_get_nominal_glyph_trampoline,
2972 user_data: trampoline,
2973 destroy: trampoline_destroy);
2974
2975 hb_font_funcs_set_variation_glyph_func (ffuncs,
2976 func: hb_font_get_variation_glyph_trampoline,
2977 user_data: trampoline,
2978 destroy: trampoline_destroy);
2979}
2980#endif
